sentences.sContent: A disheveled pile of books on the library table.
sentences.sContent_eng: A disheveled pile of books on the library table.
sentences.sCn: 图书馆的桌子上摆着一堆凌乱不整的书。

sentences.sContent: Hair disheveled like wind-blown withered grass, eyes blood-shot, shuffle languidly in the slippers.
sentences.sContent_eng: Hair disheveled like wind-blown withered grass, eyes blood-shot, shuffle languidly in the slippers.
sentences.sCn: 头发凌乱得像吹乱的枯草，眼睛布满血丝，颓然地趿拉着拖鞋。

sentences.sContent: In reality, Gates is a smooth operator who, despite his uncombed hair, baby face and disheveled appearance, knew exactly what he was doing every step of the way.
sentences.sContent_eng: In reality, Gates is a smooth operator who, despite his uncombed hair, baby face and disheveled appearance, knew exactly what he was doing every step of the way.
sentences.sCn: 在现实中，尽管盖茨的头发总是乱糟糟的，又长着张娃娃脸，不修边幅，他可是个老练的生意人，每走一步都成竹在胸。

words.tran: 使蓬乱；使头发凌乱；使衣服弄皱（dishevel的过去式）
使蓬乱；使头发凌乱；弄乱
